results.title: Road to the stamping ground
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and RM Arts
results.brief_description: A choreographical journey with Jiri Kylian of the Netherland’s Dance Theatre into the world of dance in Indigenous Australia. The documentary which opens the program follows Kylian’s visit to the Groot Eylandt tribal dance congregation in 1986 where his dance production Stamping Ground was first conceived. In Stamping Ground Kylian sought to underline the common qualities of ballet and Aboriginal tribal dance as well as fuse the two styles into a work that comments on the universal nature of human movement as a form of cultural and personal expression. Following interviews with the Dance company performers about the piece and footage of rehearsals demonstrating movements inspired by Kylian’s time at the Groot Eylandt congregation, the second half of the program is a presentation of the final performance of Stamping Ground by the Netherlands Dance Theatre Company.

results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Warren Beatty
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Warren Beatty’s reputation as a great romantic figure both on and off the screen has enthralled audiences throughout his career. Using rare film clips, production stills and coming attraction trailers this video provides an insight into his performances as an actor and his efforts as a producer and director. Also presents information about his personal life highlighting his more famous romantic encounters.

results.title: Robert Redford
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Robert Redford has enjoyed a successful career spanning decades as an actor, producer and director. Using rare production stills, coming attraction trailers and behind the scenes footage, this informative video provides an historical account of his screen career and an insight into his personal life.

results.title: Paul Newman
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
His films have won acclaim throughout the world and his star continues to shine brightly, undimmed by the many years since his first film appearance. The film career of Paul Newman is the stuff dreams are made of. Clips from some of Newman’s greatest films are featured as well as rare home movie footage of the actor relaxing at home, meeting his public and working on the set. This informative and fascinating program brings the viewer deep into the inner world of this brilliant and enigmatic artist. Contains some b & w sequences.

results.title: Road to Avonlea
results.creator_credit: Dick Benner, Paul Shapiro, Kevin Sullivan and Kevin Sullivan Productions
results.brief_description: Sara Stanley is loved by all who come in contact with her. An enchanting child, she is sent away to her mother’s birth-place on Prince Edward Island when her father’s business looks certain to crash. In Avonlea, she meets many friends and cousins with whom she shares many mischievous and charming adventures. This beautifully photographed film is delightful family viewing. Starring Sarah Polley with a special guest appearance by Colleen Dewhurst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dick Benner, Paul Shapiro, Kevin Sullivan and Kevin Sullivan Productions

results.title: Robert Frost's The death of the hired man
results.creator_credit: Jeanne Collachla and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Robert Frost’s narrative poem of the same title about an aged and no longer productive hired man, who returns to live on a couple’s farm. The film captures the couple’s apprehension over the fate of the proud, homeless man amid scenes depciting early 20th century farm life in New England.

results.title: Road of iron
results.creator_credit: Walford Hewitson, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film documents the achievements of men who forged into the harsh, untamed wilderness of northern Quebec to lay the line of steel which brought to market the rich iron ore of the Ungava region. It is a story of strength and determination since every man, machine and piece of equipment had to be airlifted in or transported by tractor caravan over the 575-kilometer route. Bit by bit we follow their progress through forest, over muskeg and across rivers until at last the first ore train snakes its way to the seaport of Septiles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walford Hewitson, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Road to Avonlea (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Dick Benner, Paul Shapiro, Kevin Sullivan and Kevin Sullivan Productions
results.brief_description: Sara Stanley is loved by all who come in contact with her. An enchanting child, she is sent away to her mother’s birth-place on Prince Edward Island when her father’s business looks certain to crash. In Avonlea, on the island, she meets many friends and cousins with whom she shares many mischievous and charming adventures. This beautifully photographed film is a delightful family film. Starring Sarah Polley with a special guest appearance by Colleen Dewhurst.
